page.title: 10The Lifeboat, Fraserburgh
page.content: By the summer of 1985 a public appeal had raised the{Â£430,000}needed to purchase the new{Tyne class lifeboat{"The City of Edinburgh"}for Fraserburgh. During the fund-raising many groups contributed to the cost of particular items of the boat's equipment, Â£79,000 was raised locally and most of the rest in Edinburgh. The{"Havelock"}was Fraserburgh's first lifeboat entered in 1858. Three Broch lifeboats have been lost in service, the most recent being the {"Duchess of Kent"}with a loss 5 out of a crew of 6 in 1970. The lifeboat shed is in the North Harbour Basin and the current Fraserburgh lifeboat is the{"R.Hope {Roberts",}a{Solent class}boat.This boat was built for{Â£72,000}in 1969 and came to Fraserburgh in 1979.
